list-events.description: List events from one or more calendars

calendarId.description: ID of the calendar(s) to list events from. Accepts either a single calendar ID string or an array of calendar IDs (passed as JSON string like ["cal1", "cal2"])

timeMin.description: Start time boundary. Preferred: '2024-01-01T00:00:00' (uses timeZone parameter or calendar timezone). Also accepts: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' or '2024-01-01T00:00:00-08:00'.

timeMax.description: End time boundary. Preferred: '2024-01-01T23:59:59' (uses timeZone parameter or calendar timezone). Also accepts: '2024-01-01T23:59:59Z' or '2024-01-01T23:59:59-08:00'.

timeZone.description: Timezone as IANA Time Zone Database name (e.g., America/Los_Angeles). Takes priority over calendar's default timezone. Only used for timezone-naive datetime strings.

fields.description: Optional array of additional event fields to retrieve. Available fields are strictly validated. Default fields (id, summary, start, end, status, htmlLink, location, attendees) are always included.

privateExtendedProperty.description: Filter by private extended properties (key=value). Matches events that have all specified properties.

sharedExtendedProperty.description: Filter by shared extended properties (key=value). Matches events that have all specified properties.

search-events.description: Search for events in a calendar by text query

calendarId.description: ID of the calendar (use 'primary' for the main calendar)

query.description: Free text search query (searches summary, description, location, attendees, etc.)

timeMin.description: Start time boundary. Preferred: '2024-01-01T00:00:00' (uses timeZone parameter or calendar timezone). Also accepts: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' or '2024-01-01T00:00:00-08:00'.

timeMax.description: End time boundary. Preferred: '2024-01-01T23:59:59' (uses timeZone parameter or calendar timezone). Also accepts: '2024-01-01T23:59:59Z' or '2024-01-01T23:59:59-08:00'.

timeZone.description: Timezone as IANA Time Zone Database name (e.g., America/Los_Angeles). Takes priority over calendar's default timezone. Only used for timezone-naive datetime strings.

fields.description: Optional array of additional event fields to retrieve. Available fields are strictly validated. Default fields (id, summary, start, end, status, htmlLink, location, attendees) are always included.

privateExtendedProperty.description: Filter by private extended properties (key=value). Matches events that have all specified properties.

sharedExtendedProperty.description: Filter by shared extended properties (key=value). Matches events that have all specified properties.

get-event.description: Get details of a specific event by ID

calendarId.description: ID of the calendar (use 'primary' for the main calendar)

eventId.description: ID of the event to retrieve

fields.description: Optional array of additional event fields to retrieve. Available fields are strictly validated. Default fields (id, summary, start, end, status, htmlLink, location, attendees) are always included.

list-colors.description: List available color IDs and their meanings for calendar events

calendarId.description: ID of the calendar (use 'primary' for the main calendar)

eventId.description: Optional custom event ID (5-1024 characters, base32hex encoding: lowercase letters a-v and digits 0-9 only). If not provided, Google Calendar will generate one.

timeZone.description: Timezone as IANA Time Zone Database name (e.g., America/Los_Angeles). Takes priority over calendar's default timezone. Only used for timezone-naive datetime strings.

attendees.description: List of event attendees with their details

colorId.description: Color ID for the event (use list-colors to see available IDs)

transparency.description: Whether the event blocks time on the calendar. 'opaque' means busy, 'transparent' means free.

visibility.description: Visibility of the event. Use 'public' for public events, 'private' for private events visible to attendees.

guestsCanInviteOthers.description: Whether attendees can invite others to the event. Default is true.

guestsCanModify.description: Whether attendees can modify the event. Default is false.

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees can see the list of other attendees. Default is true.

anyoneCanAddSelf.description: Whether anyone can add themselves to the event. Default is false.

sendUpdates.description: Whether to send notifications about the event creation. 'all' sends to all guests, 'externalOnly' to non-Google Calendar users only, 'none' sends no notifications.

conferenceData.description: Conference properties for the event. Use createRequest to add a new conference.

extendedProperties.description: Extended properties for storing application-specific data. Max 300 properties totaling 32KB.

attachments.description: File attachments for the event. Requires calendar to support attachments.

source.description: Source of the event, such as a web page or email message.

update-event.description: Update an existing calendar event with recurring event modification scope support

calendarId.description: ID of the calendar (use 'primary' for the main calendar)

eventId.description: ID of the event to update

timeZone.description: Updated timezone as IANA Time Zone Database name. If not provided, uses the calendar's default timezone.

originalStartTime.description: Original start time in the ISO 8601 format '2024-01-01T10:00:00' (required when modificationScope is 'thisEventOnly')

futureStartDate.description: Start date for future instances in the ISO 8601 format '2024-01-01T10:00:00' (required when modificationScope is 'thisAndFollowing')

calendarId.description: ID of the calendar (use 'primary' for the main calendar)

eventId.description: ID of the event to delete

get-freebusy.description: Query free/busy information for calendars. Note: Time range is limited to a maximum of 3 months between timeMin and timeMax.

calendars.description: List of calendars and/or groups to query for free/busy information

timeMin.description: Start time boundary. Preferred: '2024-01-01T00:00:00' (uses timeZone parameter or calendar timezone). Also accepts: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' or '2024-01-01T00:00:00-08:00'.

timeMax.description: End time boundary. Preferred: '2024-01-01T23:59:59' (uses timeZone parameter or calendar timezone). Also accepts: '2024-01-01T23:59:59Z' or '2024-01-01T23:59:59-08:00'.

groupExpansionMax.description: Maximum number of calendars to expand per group (max 100)

calendarExpansionMax.description: Maximum number of calendars to expand (max 50)

get-current_time.description: Get current system time and timezone information

timeZone.description: Optional IANA timezone (e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles', 'Europe/London', 'UTC'). If not provided, returns UTC time and system timezone for reference.
